Package ohos.os

Class ProcessManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.os.ProcessManager

  • public class ProcessManager
extends Object
    Obtains and manages process status.

    This class provides process-related tools to obtain and manage process status, including the following functions:

    • Obtaining the process startup and running time
    • Obtaining the process ID (PID), thread ID (TID), and user ID (UID)
    • Checking whether the current process is running in a 64-bit environment, or whether it is an isolated process
    • Getting and setting the thread priority
    • Sending a signal to the process
    Since:
    3

    • Method Detail

      • getStartUptime

        public static final long getStartUptime​()
        Obtains the elapsed time (in milliseconds) taken from the start of the system to the start of the process.

        The elapsed time does not include the system sleep time.

        Returns:
        Returns the process start time represented by the elapsed time.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        getStartRealtime()

      • getStartRealtime

        public static final long getStartRealtime​()
        Obtains the elapsed real time (in milliseconds) taken from the start of the system to the start of the process.

        The elapsed real time includes the system sleep time.

        Returns:
        Returns the process start time represented by the elapsed real time.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        getStartUptime()

      • getPastCpuTime

        public static final long getPastCpuTime​()
        Obtains the CPU time (in milliseconds) from the time when the process starts to the current time.
        Returns:
        Returns the CPU time.
        Since:
        3

      • getAvailableCores

        public static final int[] getAvailableCores​()
        Obtains CPU cores available for the current process on a multi-core device.

        The multi-core device may reserve multiple CPU cores for the current process. You can use this method to obtain available CPU cores when the process runs on the foreground.

        Returns:
        Returns an array of available CPU cores if any; returns an empty array otherwise.
        Since:
        3

        public static final int getUidByName​(String name)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

                                   throws IllegalArgumentException

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • is64Bit

        public static final boolean is64Bit​()
        Checks whether the process is running in a 64-bit environment.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the process is running in a 64-bit environment; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

        Checks whether the specified UID belongs to a particular application.
        Parameters:
        uid - Indicates the UID.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the passed UID belongs to an application; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

        Returns:
        Returns true if the process is isolated; returns false otherwise.

      • setThreadPriority

        public static final void setThreadPriority​(int priority)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                           SecurityException
        Sets the priority for the current thread.
        Parameters:
        priority - Indicates the thread priority to set. The value ranges from -20 to 19, where -20 means the highest priority and 19 means the lowest.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the thread does not exist.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if the process does not have permission to change or use the thread priority.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        setThreadPriority(int, int)

      • setThreadPriority

        public static final void setThreadPriority​(int tid,
                                           int priority)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                           SecurityException
        Sets the priority for a thread based on its TID.
        Parameters:
        tid - Indicates the TID.
        priority - Indicates the thread priority to set. The value ranges from -20 to 19, where -20 means the highest priority and 19 means the lowest.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the thread does not exist.
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if the process does not have permission to change or use the thread priority.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        setThreadPriority(int)

      • sendSignal

        public static final void sendSignal​(int pid,
                                    int signal)
        Sends the specified signal to the process based on its PID.
        Parameters:
        pid - Indicates the PID.
        signal - Indicates the signal to send. The value ranges from 1 to 64.
        Since:
        3
